definitions: Italian title of respect for a married woman, equivalent to Mrs. or madam
examples: The signora welcomed us warmly into her home
Please tell Signora Rossi that her table is ready

definitions: member of a monotheistic religion founded in Punjab in the 15th century
examples: Many Sikhs wear turbans as part of their religious practice
The Sikh community celebrates Vaisakhi every April

definitions: religion founded by Guru Nanak in the 15th century emphasizing equality and devotion to one God
examples: Sikhism teaches the importance of honest living and sharing
The Golden Temple is the holiest site in Sikhism

definitions: triangular peninsula in Egypt between the Mediterranean Sea and Red Sea
examples: Mount Sinai is believed to be where Moses received the Ten Commandments
The Sinai Peninsula connects Africa to Asia

definitions: legendary sailor hero from Middle Eastern folklore known for his seven voyages
examples: Sinbad encountered many magical creatures during his adventures
The tales of Sinbad appear in One Thousand and One Nights

definitions: sovereign city-state and island country in Southeast Asia known for economic success
examples: Singapore is one of the world's busiest ports
Many international companies have their Asian headquarters in Singapore

definitions: person who is a native or citizen of the Republic of Singapore
examples: The Singaporean delegation arrived for the trade conference
Many Singaporeans speak multiple languages including English and Mandarin

definitions: group of Native American tribes from the Great Plains region of North America
examples: The Sioux nation includes the Lakota and Dakota peoples
Many Sioux traditions are still practiced on reservations today

definitions: loud warning device that makes a wailing sound
mythical sea creature that lures sailors with enchanting music
examples: The ambulance siren wailed as it rushed through traffic
Fire trucks test their sirens every Saturday at noon
Ancient Greek sailors feared the sirens would lead them to shipwreck
In mythology, sirens were often depicted as half-woman, half-bird

definitions: person who poses for a portrait or photograph
person who watches children or pets while owners are away
examples: The artist asked the sitter to remain still for twenty minutes
The portrait sitter wore her finest dress for the painting
We need to find a reliable sitter for Saturday night
The pet sitter comes twice daily to feed the cats

definitions: major Hindu god known as the destroyer and transformer in the Hindu trinity
examples: Devotees of Siva often wear sacred ash on their foreheads
The temple dedicated to Siva attracts thousands of pilgrims annually

definitions: first United States space station that orbited Earth from 1973 to 1979
examples: Skylab proved humans could live and work in space for extended periods
Three different crews visited Skylab during its operational life

definitions: member of any of the peoples of eastern Europe who speak Slavic languages
examples: Many Slavs migrated to North America in the early 20th century
The Slav peoples share similar linguistic and cultural traditions

definitions: group of related languages spoken by Slavic peoples in Eastern Europe
examples: Russian and Polish are both Slavic languages
Slavic languages use either Cyrillic or Latin alphabets

definitions: old form of Slavic language used in religious texts and liturgy
examples: Old Church Slavonic was the first Slavic literary language
Many Orthodox churches still use Slavonic in their services

definitions: native or citizen of Slovakia in Central Europe
West Slavic language spoken primarily in Slovakia
examples: The Slovak athlete won three medals at the Olympics
Many Slovak immigrants settled in Pennsylvania mining towns
She's learning Slovak to communicate with her grandparents
Slovak uses the Latin alphabet with special diacritical marks

definitions: landlocked country in Central Europe that was formerly part of Czechoslovakia
examples: Slovakia joined the European Union in 2004
The capital of Slovakia is Bratislava

definitions: native or citizen of Slovenia in southeastern Europe
South Slavic language spoken primarily in Slovenia
examples: The Slovene artist exhibited her work in galleries worldwide
Many Slovenes enjoy skiing in their mountainous country
Slovene has dual grammatical number in addition to singular and plural
She studied Slovene to better understand her family heritage

definitions: small country in Central Europe bordered by Italy, Austria, Hungary, and Croatia
examples: Slovenia was the first former Yugoslav republic to join the EU
Lake Bled in Slovenia is a popular tourist destination

definitions: native or citizen of Slovenia or relating to Slovenia and its people
examples: The Slovenian team performed well in winter sports competitions
Slovenian cuisine combines Mediterranean and Central European influences

definitions: person who works with metal, especially by heating and hammering
most common surname in English-speaking countries
examples: The blacksmith forged horseshoes in his workshop
The village smith repaired tools and farm equipment
John Smith is often used as a generic name in examples
The Smith family has lived in this town for generations

definitions: beloved beagle character from Charles Schulz's Peanuts comic strip
examples: Snoopy often imagines himself as a World War I flying ace
Children love watching Snoopy dance in the holiday specials

definitions: trendy area in London's West End known for entertainment and nightlife
neighborhood in Manhattan known for cast-iron buildings and art galleries
examples: Many theaters and restaurants are located in London's Soho
Soho in London has been an entertainment district for centuries
Artists transformed New York's SoHo into a creative hub
SoHo stands for South of Houston Street in Manhattan

definitions: ancient city destroyed by God for wickedness according to biblical accounts
examples: The destruction of Sodom and Gomorrah appears in Genesis
Sodom became a symbol of divine judgment against sin

definitions: Roman god of the sun in ancient mythology
fifth note of the musical scale in solmization
examples: Sol Invictus was an important deity in late Roman religion
Ancient Romans dedicated December 25th to Sol
In the song Do-Re-Mi, sol follows fa
The choir practiced singing sol at the correct pitch

definitions: wise king of Israel known for building the First Temple in Jerusalem
examples: King Solomon was famous for his wisdom in judging disputes
The Song of Solomon is attributed to this biblical king

definitions: native or inhabitant of Somalia in East Africa
Cushitic language spoken in Somalia and neighboring regions
examples: The Somali community celebrates their cultural festivals annually
Many Somali refugees have resettled in Minnesota
She's taking Somali classes to work with immigrant families
Somali uses the Latin alphabet since 1972

definitions: country in the Horn of Africa bordered by Ethiopia, Kenya, and the Indian Ocean
examples: Somalia has the longest coastline on Africa's mainland
International efforts continue to stabilize Somalia

definitions: traditional Mexican hat with a very wide brim to provide shade from sun
examples: The mariachi musicians wore decorated sombreros during their performance
Tourists often buy colorful sombreros as souvenirs from Mexico

definitions: ancient Greek teacher of philosophy and rhetoric who charged fees for instruction
examples: Sophists traveled between Greek cities teaching wealthy students
Plato criticized the sophists for their relativistic teachings

definitions: historic university in Paris founded in 1257 and center of French higher education
examples: Many famous intellectuals have studied at the Sorbonne
The Sorbonne remains one of Europe's most prestigious universities

definitions: drought-resistant cereal grain grown for food, animal feed, and syrup production
examples: Farmers plant sorghum in areas too dry for corn
Sweet sorghum can be processed into a molasses-like syrup

definitions: person who lives in or comes from the southern part of a country
examples: Many southerners moved north for factory jobs during industrialization
The southerner spoke with a distinctive regional accent

definitions: artistic and architectural style from the southwestern United States blending Native American and Spanish influences
examples: The restaurant featured southwestern decor with adobe walls and turquoise accents
Southwestern cuisine combines Mexican and Native American flavors

definitions: country in southwestern Europe occupying most of the Iberian Peninsula
examples: Spain is famous for flamenco dancing and bullfighting
Many tourists visit Spain for its beaches and historic cities

definitions: canned precooked pork product introduced by Hormel in 1937
unsolicited bulk messages sent electronically, especially email
examples: Spam became popular during World War II due to its long shelf life
Hawaii consumes more Spam per capita than any other state
My email filter caught over 100 spam messages this week
Don't click on links in spam emails as they may contain viruses

definitions: native or citizen of Spain or person of Spanish descent
examples: The Spaniard won the tennis tournament for the third consecutive year
Many Spaniards take an afternoon siesta during hot summer days

definitions: ancient Greek city-state known for its military culture and warrior society
examples: Sparta rivaled Athens for dominance in ancient Greece
Young boys in Sparta began military training at age seven

definitions: citizen or soldier of ancient Sparta known for discipline and courage
lifestyle marked by simplicity, frugality, and lack of comfort
examples: The Spartan warriors were feared throughout ancient Greece
Spartan soldiers trained from childhood to become elite fighters
Their spartan apartment contained only essential furniture
He lived a spartan existence focused on work and study

definitions: mythical creature with a human head and lion's body
ancient Egyptian monument near the pyramids of Giza
examples: In Greek mythology, the sphinx posed riddles to travelers
The sphinx guarded the entrance to the ancient city
The Great Sphinx of Giza is over 4,500 years old
Tourists marvel at the massive sphinx near the pyramids

definitions: brightest star in the constellation Virgo and one of the brightest stars in the night sky
examples: Spica is actually a binary star system about 250 light-years away
Ancient farmers used Spica's position to determine planting seasons

definitions: logical half-human, half-Vulcan science officer from Star Trek television series
examples: Mr. Spock's famous greeting is 'Live long and prosper'
Spock became an icon of logic and reason in popular culture

definitions: Soviet dictator who ruled the USSR from 1924 to 1953
examples: Stalin transformed the Soviet Union into an industrial power
Millions died under Stalin's brutal regime

definitions: Soviet city site of major World War II battle, now called Volgograd
examples: The Battle of Stalingrad marked a turning point in World War II
Stalingrad endured months of devastating urban warfare
